text:
Hi <@U05E8CWD5DE>, I keep getting this error;
```{"status":"error","message":"You can only request at most 500 associations at once.","correlationId":"f54a33df-88aa-46a1-a7a6-88aff5ea6032","context":{"limit":["1000"]},"category":"VALIDATION_ERROR"}```
This is my URL: `<https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v4/objects/companies/${hs_object_id}/associations/2-114955916?limit=1000${after}>`

Hello Everyone
I want to fetch the contacts which has been created within the given time limit. I want to try it through API. Is there any work around possible?

See if you can use the HubSpot Contacts Search API and <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/crm/search#:~:text=all%20tasks%20that%20were%20last%20modified%20within%20a%20specific%20time%20range|filter by the created time>.
Are just use the HubSpot portal…
<@U017458R1MH> I want to try it through API

```{"eventTemplateId":"pe26294192_kauf","timestamp":"2023-07-07T09:52:44+00:00","objectId":"3235254","id":"9996a8d2-2788-4860-96fb-70f5ad6a358c","tokens":{"order_amount":500,"orderable_name":"BWF Welttour: Turnierpass - Taipei Open"}}```
Thats the request <@U05EJLL49KQ>
<@U05EPH41RA8> endpoint?
/integrators/timeline/v3/events
In that case most likely the Contacts API

Reminder: *Want to be the first to know when a new API is available or an existing API has a new version?*  We publish all of that on our <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|Developer Changelog>.  While we do our best to avoid <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/breaking-change-definition|breaking changes> to our APIs, sometimes for security, and reliability we have to. The Changelog is where we’ll post announcements ahead of time about it. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/changelog|Subscribe to the Developer Changelog> to stay up-to-date on what’s happening in the world of HubSpot development.
Hi! Have any way to see single property history from a deal using HubSpot lib on python? I'm trying to retrieve all my deals and alteration history of stage field.

```client = HubSpot.Client.create(access_token=os.getenv("HubSpot_TOKEN"), retry=retry)
deal_list = client.crm.deals.get_all(
    archived=False,
    properties=PROPERTIES,
    properties_with_history=["dealstage"],
    limit=50,)```
requestSignature is probably equal to `"yoursecret[object Object]"`
I would use `req.rawBody` if it is defined or I believe `JSON.stringify(req.body)` will have the same effect

Hey everyone! I have a question about engagements properties.
I'm trying to call some properties, but I need the name of the properties, just the HubSpot name.
There is a place where I can find all the names of the agagements properties? (Trying to retrieve calls and meetings)
Thanks a lot!

`GET <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/properties/call>`
and
`GET <https://api.hubapi.com/crm/v3/properties/meeting>`
thanks!

Is there a way to fetch whether a company would be created for a specific domain when a contact is created?
I.e. I'd like to NOT create companies for domains like `<http://yahoo.com|yahoo.com>` but I also don't wanna keep a allow/deny-list for such domains :thinkonk:
settings > data management > objects > companies
I think excluding <http://yahoo.com|yahoo.com> as a domain should work
didn’t see this sorry `but I also don't wanna keep a allow/deny-list for such domains :thinkonk:`
Personally I turned off automatic company creation/association altogether … seems more reliable/safe that way :open_mouth:

Hi everyone!
We have a customer who is using HubSpot (Marketing and Sales) with a "quote" form on their webpage. The form currently creates a contact while being vetted, and then a deal is created and either accepted or rejected.
We are interested in finding a way to push the form-filled data to our API once the deal is accepted. The data we would like to push includes fields such as Name, Collection Location, Delivery Location, Vehicle, and potential Price.
Our goal is to streamline the booking process by integrating their HubSpot form with our booking system.
If anyone has any thoughts or insights on how we can achieve this integration, I would greatly appreciate your input.

Just to add some more questions. After deal_stage property is changed, we use webhook to call external API, would the event payload contain on deal_stage change, does it have all the deal information or do we need to call an API to get it?
